results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations on [n] that are self-inverse on [k] but not on [k+1]; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) counts permutations p:{1,...,n}-> {1,...,n} with p(p(i))=i for all i in {1,...,k} and p(p(k+1))<>k+1 if k<n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = H(n,k) - H(n,k+1) with H(n,k) = Sum_{i=0..min(k,n-k)} C(n-k,i) * C(k,i) * i! * A000085(k-i) * (n-k-i)!.
mathematica: H[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n - k, i]*Binomial[k, i]*i!*
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 10 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
